TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MessageDescription extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents the description of a message.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription> contains the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Headers%2A> and <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Body%2A> properties to provide get access to these parts of the message. Whether the message is incoming or outgoing is indicated by the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Direction%2A> property. It also provides an <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription.Action%2A> property where the URI that indicates the intension of the message may be specified.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDescription> returned from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription.Messages%2A> property of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.OperationDescription> class. The code iterates through the collection of endpoints and prints each endpoint name, as well as the name of each operation in the endpoint.
[!code-csharp[DataContractSerializerOperationBehavior#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/datacontractserializeroperationbehavior/cs/source.cs#2)] [!code-vb[DataContractSerializerOperationBehavior#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/datacontractserializeroperationbehavior/vb/source.vb#2)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string action, valuetype System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection direction) cil managed

Docs.param: The action parameter of the SOAP message that identifies the intent of the message.
if the message is incoming or if the message is outgoing.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified action and direction.
Gets or sets the action parameter of the SOAP message that identifies the intent of the message.
Docs.value: A that contains the action URI.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This optional parameter can be used to specify the URI that identifies the intent of the message. In SOAP 1.2, it serves a similar purpose as the SOAPAction HTTP header field did in SOAP 1.1.
The value of the action parameter is an absolute URI reference as defined by RFC 2396. The SOAP 1.2 specification does not require that the URI be resolvable. The URI should be globally unique and stable over time.
Servers, such as firewalls, can use the presence and content of the action parameter to filter SOAP messages and to facilitate the dispatch of SOAP messages to internal message handlers. It should not be used as an insecure form of access authorization.
Use of the action parameter is optional. SOAP receivers can use it as a hint to optimize processing, but must not require its presence to operate.

Docs.summary: Gets the body of the SOAP message.
Docs.value: The that contains the body of the message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A SOAP body provides a mechanism for transmitting information to an ultimate SOAP receiver.

Docs.summary: Gets the direction that indicates whether the message is incoming or outgoing.
Docs.value: The that indicates whether the message is incoming to or outgoing from the service.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Incoming means that the message is coming from the client to the server. This is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Input> direction. Outgoing means the message is coming from the server to the client. This is the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Output> direction. These terms can be confusing from the client perspective where the messages marked as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Input> are actually being sent and the messages marked as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MessageDirection.Output> are being received.

Docs.value: A that identifies the type of message contract.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The message type can be `null`.

Docs.summary: Gets a description of the properties of the SOAP message.
Docs.value: The that contains the descriptions of the properties of the SOAP message.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the security services required for the message.
Docs.value: The value of that specified the security services required for the message.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The security services are used to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and authentication of the data contained in the message.
